item.title: Imperial reach next round in Cup
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: It’s safe to say that the ICUAFC 6th XI hasn’t had the best of starts to the season. However, when it comes to the cup, league form is thrown out of the window and we made the epic journey to North London with confidence to play RUMS (UCL Medics) 3s. item.title: Imperial Sail Past Brighton
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: On a windy Wednesday in west London, Imperial 1st XV hosted Brighton at Harlington for their third match of the season. Off the back of a 24-0 win against their inferior university colleagues, IC were brimming with confidence going into this game with a very strong team on paper, only missing centre …

item.title: Imperial Thump RUMS in Shenley
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: ICUAFC 5’s set off on the long trip to North London on Saturday for a matchup against London rivals RUMS 3’s. item.title: Imperial has good showing at Spooky Duathlon
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: On Sunday 27th, six fellow triathletes (plus old boy Sam O’Neil) took to Hyde Park to take part in the Jekyll and Hyde Park Halloween Duathlon. With the clocks going back alarms were tentatively set, not really knowing whether we’d unknowingly cause ourselves to turn up to the race an hour early or …

item.title: Imperial Brush Aside the Medics
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: After a poor first performance against UCL last week, IC Rugby’s 1st XV desperately needed to turn up with their heads switched on. item.title: Triathlon Club make a splash at Aquathlon
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: The first event of the tri club racing calendar brought nine athletes to London Fields, competing in the swim-run combo known as an aquathlon. This early season competition was an opportunity to blow away some of the summer cobwebs for returning members, whilst for a couple of others it was an …

item.title: ICUCC beaten by UCL
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: With his 100% winning record as skipper on the line, Vignesh Venkateswaran once again took up the reins of captaincy as he led the ICUCC 1st XI to face off against arch-rivals UCL, in a nail-biting London derby. Conditions could not have been more perfect; it was warmer outside the scorebox than …

item.title: Sun, sea, sand: Fellwanderers hike Pembrokeshire
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: Friday, 24th of May: a rainy day in London, what else would you expect? But 12 brave, hiking loving students were ready to leave for Pembrokeshire, Wales on a Fellwanderers weekend trip. Since it was a bank holiday weekend, it took us quite a while to get to Wales. But by the time we arrived, it …

item.title: Tenpin get bowled over
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: The British University Tenpin Bowling Association (BUTBA) Cup final against Loughborough, Sheffield, and Portsmouth took place in Rugby last bank holiday Sunday. item.title: BUCS points galore for ICBC in Boston

item.title: Men’s Water Polo handle their balls right

item.description: The men’s water polo team are midway through what has already been our most successful season to date. item.title: Runners dominate Luton relays again
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: Last Sunday morning, our four Imperial teams arrived in a sunny but cold Luton, ready to once again dominate the Luton Marathon Relays. item.title: Shorinji Kempo

item.description: It is a Sunday morning in Finsbury Park. Unusually for London in November, the sun’s rays play across the city, giving relief from the slight chill in the air. item.title: Fencing avoid the fake tan

item.title: Just keep running, running...
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: On Wednesday 17th October saw 42 runners from Imperial College make the journey to north London to take on the “mountains” of Hampstead Heath. item.title: ICSM Netball’s storming start to the season

item.title: Gaelic Football girls score at double header

item.title: Imperial Mints pot black in Nottingham

item.title: Netball 2s continue winning streak

item.description: This week saw a busy week for ICUNC with 8 scheduled games and the first LUSL games of the season. Lack of familiarity within the 1sts and small mistakes give plenty to work on in training, …

item.title: LAX women crush opposition

item.description: On Wednesday the 17th, the Imperial Womens’ first team played their first match of the season against Reading. item.title: IC Rowers get more golds

item.title: IC Rowers take on World U23s in Trakai

item.description: The Under-23 World Championships were held in Trakai, Lithuania between 11th- 15th July. This year medic Tim Richards and biochemist Wilf Kimberley donned the triple hooped vests to represent their country and defend Imperial’s honour which they did in style. The road to Trakai was by no means easy …

item.title: Mud in Manchester
item.author: Felix Sport,

item.title: Testing Triathlon waters
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: I joined Imperial’s triathlon club in October 2011, with no real intention of ever competing in any triathlon; all I wanted was to come to the swimming sessions so that I could keep eating pies while a stress fracture healed. But even as Christmas rolled round and my foot went back to working order, …

item.title: First ever Imperial all-ladies bowling team

item.description: Last November, bowlers from Imperial College London competed at the regional BUTBA (British University Tenpin Bowling Association) competition and blazed the lanes, emerging as 1st runners up. Congratulations to Christopher Chan who bowled an average of 211, ranked 2nd overall and to all the other …

item.title: Riding 1st team grab league top spot
item.author: Felix Sport,
item.description: The first riding team have moved into first place in their league after an impressive win in Buckinghamshire on Wednesday.
